name: Greek Myth for Experts, Part 2 Online Quiz | Humanities | 10 Questions

questions.text: She was the daughter of Coeus and Phoebe, and one of the many lovers of Zeus.  Hera became so jealous of her that she did not allow her daughter Eileithyia (goddess of childbirth) to assist, forcing this woman to give birth at Delos to her famous pair of twins.  What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Leto.

	Leto was the motherof Artemis and Apollo, two of the twelve Olympian gods.  No wonder Hera was so jealous!

questions.text: Which goddess, daughter of Perses and granddaughter of the Titan Crius, was known as the 'Lady of the Night'?
questions.explanation:
Hecate.

	Hecate was the goddess of abundance and eloquence. She was also  a reknowned magician...the goddess of magic. She could change into various animal forms, such as dogs and wolves.

questions.text: Who was the lesser known brother of the Titans: Atlas, Prometheus and Epimetheus?
questions.explanation:
Menoetius.

	He was one of the conspirators in a revolt against Zeus and paid for his crime by taking a thunderbolt and a trip to Tartarus.  Ouch!

questions.text: Which Titan, the last born, was the progenitor of the most important family of gods in Greek myth?
questions.correct: Cronus & Cronos & Kronos & Kronus & Chronus & Chronos
questions.explanation:
Cronus & Cronos & Kronos & Kronus & Chronus & Chronos.

	Cronos was the father of Zeus and his siblings, Zeus being the youngest.  King of the Titans, he was overthrown by his beloved (?) children!

questions.text: Arges, Steropes and Brontes were members of which group mentioned below?
questions.explanation:
Cyclopes.

	The Cyclopes were Storm-spirits brought to life by Uranus and Gaea, some of the earliest creatures of Greek myth.

questions.text: Which of the following was not one of the Hecatoncheires, the hundred-handed giants given life by Uranus and Gaea?
questions.explanation:
Enyo.

	Uranus hated the hecatoncheires and kept them locked away in the depths of the Earth, much to Gaea's displeasure.  She released them when she needed a hand...ha!

questions.text: What did Cronos do to Uranus at the request of Gaea?
questions.explanation:
Castrated him.

	Gaea was tired of having to procreate with her husband so she had Cronus do her dirty work.  An ancient Lorena Bobbitt, to be sure!

questions.text: Which of these was NOT a name for the three goddesses Alecto, Tisiphone and Megara?
questions.explanation:
Hesperides.

	The Furies, also known as the Erinnyes or Eumenides, were dwellers of Hades who tortured the souls of evil human beings.  They were born from the blood of Uranus when he was castrated.  It's no wonder that something so angry came from such a painful event!

questions.text: Who was the god of sarcasm, the offspring of night?
questions.explanation:
Momos.

	Momos is a really important god, and extremely well-known too.  Oh wait, that was just sarcasm...

questions.text: Who was the 'Old Man of the Sea' in this mythology?
questions.explanation:
Nereus.

	In the bottom of the sea dwelt this 'old man' with his wife Doris.  Their children were the 50 nereids, nymphs of the sea.  This 'Old Man of the Sea' is not to be confused with Hemingway's 'Old Man and the Sea'!  I hope you have enjoyed this quiz...you are invited to try my other quizzes on myth if you feel inclined...thanks!
